TITLE: Pacific Northwest Restaurants Struggle During Heat Wave
SUMMARY: Punishing heat has owners closing early, canceling outdoor dining and wondering about their future in a region where air-conditioning is not the norm.

TITLE: YouTube Automation Sprouts Cottage Industry That Promises Fast Money
SUMMARY: A cottage industry is persuading people to spend thousands to create video businesses on YouTube. Disclaimer: It is harder than it looks.

TITLE: How Some Ukrainians Are Starting Over
SUMMARY: Ukrainians forced from their hometowns by Russia’s invasion find some solace, and success, setting up shop in a new city.

TITLE: The Rise of Knotless Braids
SUMMARY: A new style has driven up demand at salons in Harlem and Brooklyn.

TITLE: Hacer canales exitosos en YouTube no es tan fácil como parece
SUMMARY: Muchos instructores e influentes persuaden a las personas para que gasten miles de dólares con el fin de crear videos exitosos en YouTube. Sin embargo, es mucho más difícil de lo que parece.

TITLE: The Boy Bosses of Silicon Valley Are on Their Way Out
SUMMARY: They rode their unicorns to fame and fortune. In a rocky market, it got a little less fun.

TITLE: Ivory Coast, a Big Cocoa Exporter, Tries to Move Up the Ladder
SUMMARY: A new generation of Ivory Coast chocolatiers is striving to change an industry that has long left cocoa farmers in poverty.

TITLE: Los jefes de Silicon Valley van de salida
SUMMARY: El retiro de varios jóvenes directores ejecutivos, y las dificultades económicas, indican el fin de una era en Silicon Valley.

TITLE: David Kinch, an Acclaimed Bay Area Chef, Will Leave Manresa
SUMMARY: He’ll sell his 20-year-old fine-dining restaurant in Los Gatos, Calif., which has three Michelin stars, at the end of the year.

TITLE: Expansion of Clean Energy Loans Is ‘Sleeping Giant’ of Climate Bill
SUMMARY: The bill President Biden signed into law recently will greatly expand government loans and loan guarantees for clean energy and automotive projects and businesses.

TITLE: Black Developers Elevate Community Needs in Major Projects
SUMMARY: In multibillion-dollar projects around the nation, Black builders are investing in neighborhoods through commitments to inclusion, affordable housing and diversity hiring.

TITLE: Acclaimed Bay Area Chef David Kinch of Manresa Will Leave Restaurant
SUMMARY: He’ll sell his 20-year-old fine-dining restaurant in Los Gatos, Calif., which has three Michelin stars, at the end of the year.

TITLE: Karaoke Singers Live the Dream at the Illinois State Fair
SUMMARY: Near the 500-pound Butter Cow, 16 contestants performed songs by Whitney Houston, Billy Joel, Jamey Johnson and Shania Twain in a bid to win $500 and appear on the Grandstand Stage.

TITLE: Kazuo Inamori, Major Industrialist in Postwar Japan, Dies at 90
SUMMARY: Founding two giant companies, he helped turn his country into an economic giant while encouraging employees to approach work with an almost spiritual devotion.
